result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order for Examination under 971.16, Wis. Stats. (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 10/13/22

10:36 AM Defendant Latania D Gatson in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Latania D Gatson.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense would like to enter a special plea of NGI according to Wis. Stats. 971.16 on both cases.
Court accepts change of plea and orders an examination to be completed by a doctor from Behavioral Consultants.
Report to be filed by 12/1/22.
Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:18 AM Defendant Latania D Gatson in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Latania D Gatson.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:27 AM Defendant Latania D Gatson in court.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defendant states she did not know she had to be reevaluated by the SPD for every case and states she is going to the SPD right after court to be reevaluated.
ADA Tempelis takes no position.
The Court orders the Defendant to go directly to the SPD right after court.
The Court will adjourn. 
Preliminary time limits previously waived.
The Court will set a Status Conference for status of counsel - should an attorney be appointed the Status Conference will be taken off the calendar.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED 06/16/2022:  The Court removes GPS monitoring through WCS.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Victim C/Victim D/Victim E listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, with the exception of incidental contact as the Victims are the defendants neighbors.  The defendant is not to speak to the neighbors at all.  

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

02:48 PM Defendant Latania D Gatson in court by telephone means with attorney Brandon K. Carlson, in person for attorney Abigail Broze.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court was notified by Attorney Carlson that the defendant lives next door to the Victims.  State maintains their position as to no contact and GPS monitoring.  The Court will remove GPS monitoring.  Court maintains the no contact orders with the exception of incidental contact and defendant is not to speak to the neighbors at all.  The Court puts the defendant on notice if the Court receives information that the defendant has violated this, cash bail would be imposed.  Defendant to report to the Criminal Traffic Division to sign the amended bond.  Next date remains as previously set.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Victim C/Victim D/Victim E listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A/Victim B/Victim C/Victim D/Victim E, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS after Court today.

12:59 PM Defendant Latania D Gatson in court with attorney Brandon K. Carlson on behalf of Attorney Abigail Broze.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on May 12, 2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
